marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: In terms of valuation, this acquisition value represents an EV/Reserves of approximately 5.6 billion Rupiah per ounce and EV/Resources of 2.8 billion Rupiah per ounce, below the average valuation of peers which reached 11.5 billion Rupiah per ounce and 8.3 billion Rupiah per ounce, respectively (see table above). In terms of contribution, UNTR's gold reserves and resources will increase by +38% and +42% respectively, to 5,734 koz and 10,507 koz after this transaction is completed. However, due to UNTR's large scale, this acquisition value (enterprise value) is only equivalent to ~9% of UNTR's EV as of Monday (15/9). UNTR's stock price has strengthened by +8.8% in the last 1 month. Meanwhile, for PSAB, the Doup mine is one of the company's main assets, where Doup's reserves and resources are equivalent to 61% and 51% of PSAB's total reserves and resources, respectively.

marketNews.title: Other hot things you need to know...
marketNews.content: 1. The Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, said on Monday (15/9) that the government will provide an economic stimulus package worth ~16.2 trillion Rupiah in 4Q25. This stimulus package consists of 8 programs, which are: 1) internship program for university graduates; 2) expansion of government-borne Income Tax (PPh) 21 (DTP) for workers in the tourism sector; 3) food assistance; 4) work accident and death benefit assistance for non-wage workers such as online motorcycle taxi partners; 5) additional service benefit program for BPJS Ketenagakerjaan housing; 6) cash for work program; 7) acceleration of deregulation of Government Regulation (PP) No. 28; 8) and an urban pilot project in DKI Jakarta to improve settlement quality and provide space for the gig economy. 2. The Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, said on Monday (15/9) that the government will continue 4 incentive programs in 2026, including: 1) final income tax incentive of 0.5% for individual MSME taxpayers, extended until 2029; 2) government-borne Income Tax (PPh) 21 (DTP) incentive for tourism sector workers with salaries up to 10 million per month; 3) PPh 21 DTP for workers in labor-intensive sectors with salaries up to 10 million per month; and 4) discount on work accident and death insurance premiums for non-wage workers. 3. The Minister of Finance, Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa, said on Monday (15/9) that the financing scheme for the Village Cooperatives (Kopdes) Merah Putih will use a liquidity injection of 200 trillion Rupiah placed by the government into state-owned bank conglomerates (Himbara). On the same occasion, the Coordinating Minister for Food Affairs, Zulkifli Hasan, said that the government requested an acceleration of loan disbursement for the Kopdes Merah Putih program, adding that the government wants 16,000 Kopdes to be funded by the end of this month. The government noted that Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI), Bank Mandiri (BMRI), Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI), and Bank Syariah Indonesia (BRIS), have identified over 1,000 qualifying Kopdes potentially borrowing 1.06 trillion Rupiah. Purbaya explained that Himbara can reduce the interest they pay on government deposits to 2% if the funds are channeled to Kopdes. Previously, Bank Tabungan Negara (BBTN) explained that the placement of these government cash reserves will be placed in a 6-month renewable call deposit instrument with an interest/yield of ~4%. 4. The national cement industry sales volume fell -3.8% YoY in August 2025, according to data from Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa (INTP) management. This result caused the national cement industry's sales volume for 8M25 to fall -3.3% YoY (vs. 8M24 including Grobogan cement: +2.3% YoY). INTP management explained that the decline in industry-wide cement sales volume was affected by demonstration activities in late August 2025. In terms of segmentation, bagged cement sales volume weakened -0.3% YoY during 8M25 (vs. 8M24: -1.7% YoY), while bulk cement fell -10% YoY (vs. 8M24: +12% YoY). 5. The Directorate General of Taxes of the Ministry of Finance noted that net tax revenue, or tax deposits after deducting refunds, reached 990.01 trillion Rupiah during 7M25 (-5.29% YoY), equivalent to 47.7% of the 2025 State Budget (APBN) outlook target of 2,077 trillion Rupiah. Meanwhile, gross tax revenue, or total tax deposits before refunds, reached 1,269.4 trillion Rupiah during 7M25 (+2.3% YoY). 6. The Solvent Extractors' Association of India noted that India's palm oil imports in August 2025 rose to 990,528 tons (+15.8% MoM), marking the highest monthly level since July 2024. This realization was driven by more competitive palm oil prices compared to soybean oil, thus boosting purchases ahead of the festive season.

marketNews.title: The Fed, BI, BOJ: Packed Agenda That Could Shake the Stock Market
marketNews.content: "In conditions like the next 1 week, everyone usually chooses to move to the most secure safe heaven available right now." - williams1011

tickerNews.title: UNTR to Acquire PSAB's Doup Mine via Subsidiaries
tickerNews.content: United Tractors (UNTR) through its subsidiaries, PT Danusa Tambang Nusantara and PT Energia Prima Nusantara, announced that they have signed an agreement to acquire 100% of the shares of PT Arafura Surya Alam (ASA) - the operator and owner of the Doup gold mining business license in North Sulawesi - from PT J Resources Nusantara (JRN), which is a subsidiary of J Resources Asia Pasifik (PSAB). The total enterprise value for ASA agreed upon reached 540 million US Dollars or ~8.9 trillion Rupiah, based on the Rupiah to US Dollar exchange rate of 16,410. PSAB explained that the total enterprise value includes the share sale value, the share value for minority shareholders in ASA and PT Mulia Bumi Persada as a subsidiary of ASA, as well as the shareholder debt value from JRN to ASA. PSAB also stated that the net value of the share sale will be adjusted based on the position of certain balance sheet items of ASA on the date of completion of the planned transaction. The final transaction completion date is no later than December 23, 2025, or at another time agreed upon by the respective parties in the transaction plan. UNTR Corporate Secretary, Sara K. Loebis, said that this acquisition will be funded by the company's internal cash. As of December 31, 2023, the Doup gold mine had total reserves of 1,571 koz of gold with total resources of 3,107 koz of gold. The Doup gold project has not yet operated as of December 2024.

tickerNews.title: INTP: Sales Volume -4.6% YoY in 8M25
tickerNews.content: 1. INTP: Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa recorded a -8.3% YoY decrease in cement sales volume in August 2025, with bulk cement sales volume and bagged cement sales volume falling by -13% YoY and -6% YoY, respectively. This result caused INTP's cement sales volume to weaken by -4.6% YoY during 8M25 (vs. 8M24 including Grobogan cement: +10% YoY), with the company's market share dropping to 29.3% (vs. 8M24: 29.7%, 1H25: 29.5%). INTP management explained that sales at several points were affected by demonstration actions at the end of August 2025. 2. CDIA: Chandra Daya Investasi recorded a net profit of 67.8 million US Dollars in 1H25 (+330% YoY), driven by a gain from the change in fair value of investments amounting to 46.6 million US Dollars (vs. 1H24: none). CDIA's other financial assets consist of a 4.99% stake in Raharja Energi Cepu (RATU), 0.33% in Nippon Shokubai Co., Ltd., and 0.45% in Keppel Infrastructure Trust. On the top-line side, revenue during 1H25 grew +42% YoY to 66.9 million US Dollars, primarily driven by the logistics segment with revenue of 15 million US Dollars (VS. 1H24: 0.1 million US Dollars). 3. TPIA: Aster Chemicals and Energy - a joint venture between Chandra Asri Pacific and Glencore - announced that it has signed a 1 billion US Dollar sustainability-linked loan syndication facility. The funds will be used for general needs, including asset rejuvenation projects on Bukom and Jurong Islands. DBS Bank Ltd. and OCBC acted as mandated lead arrangers, underwriters, and bookrunners (MLAUBs) as well as sustainability coordinators. This syndication facility was also joined by several national banks, such as Bank Mandiri (BMRI), Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI), and Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI). 4. BUVA: Bukit Uluwatu Villa's controller, Hapsoro, sold ~483.3 million BUVA shares at an average price of 269 Rupiah per share on September 10-11, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~130 billion Rupiah. After this transaction, Hapsoro's direct ownership portion in BUVA decreased from 7.91% to 5.56%. Previously, BUVA planned to conduct a rights issue of up to ~4 billion new shares with an exercise price of 150 Rupiah per share, a ratio of 225:44, and a dilution effect of up to 16.36%. PT Nusantara Utama Investama stated it would become a standby buyer, with Hapsoro transferring his rights to PT Nusantara Utama Investama. 5. JSMR: Jasa Marga President Director, Rivan A. Purwantono, said that the company is opening opportunities to invest in toll roads owned by State-Owned Construction Enterprises (BUMN Karya), although he did not elaborate further. Rivan explained that one strategy is to invest in toll road segments connected to the company's existing toll segments. JSMR will also remain focused on toll roads in Java Island. For 2025, JSMR has allocated capex of around 10-12 trillion Rupiah, with absorption as of 1H25 reaching ~5 trillion Rupiah. 6. ELSA: Elnusa Director, Arief Prasetyo Handoyo, said that the company is developing 3 businesses still in the pilot project stage, namely carbon capture utilization and storage (CCUS), fabrication for binary heat exchanger geothermal and inflow control, and battery charging stations for the electric vehicle ecosystem.
